pr_title: Prevent dropping of a UDF used inside a generated col expression

timeline.message:
Prevent dropping of a UDF used inside a generated col expression

UDFs which are used inside any generated column expression must
not be able to be dropped, otherwise the table info fails on
resolving, making the table unusable.

timeline.bodyText: We must pass in the schemas here instead of getting it as a guice singleton on the ctor to avoid circular dependencies.

timeline.bodyText:
Shouldn't this operate on the currentState of the ClusterStateUpdateTask ?
Schemas is updated via clusterChanged events and I think there could be some race conditions - e.g. UDF being dropped while concurrently a new table is created that uses it.
timeline.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: right, also recognized just now. will come up with a new approach.
replies.author: seut

replies.bodyText: I've pushed a fixup solving this.
replies.author: seut

replies.bodyText:
Did you consider going through the metadata directly and use the DocTableInfoFactory or DocTableInfoBuilder builder to create the instances?
Iterating over schemas will include the built-in schemas which we know that they don't have generated columns. I think there's also more overhead involved as it adds the instances to internal maps and so on.
Also fine to keep it as is for me - given that dropping UDFs shouldn't be a common operation.
replies.author: mfussenegger

replies.bodyText: good point, was even simple to do. pushed another fixup (this also reverts the commit before).
replies.author: seut
